description: Details required by Condition 14 (Construction Management Plan) and Condition 17 (Contamination) of Planning Application 18/10299/FUL
decision_conditions: That the applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that the conditions, as noted above, are fully discharged

The Party Wall Act 1996 requires a building owner to notify, and obtain formal agreement from, any adjoining owner, where the building owner proposes to:iv.carry out work to an existing party wall;v.build on the boundary with a neighbouring property;vi.in some circumstances, carry out groundworks within 6 metres of an adjoining building.Notification and agreements under this Act are the responsibility of the building owner and are quite separate from Building Regulations, or Planning Controls. The Building Control Service will assume that an applicant has obtained any necessary agreements with the adjoining owner, and nothing said or implied by the Council should be taken as removing the necessity for the building owner to comply fully with the Party Wall Act. Further information and advice is to be found in "The Party Walls etc. Act 1996 - Explanatory Booklet".
Please be advised that a fee of Â£1250 is required for this application. This can be paid either online at www.kingston.gov.uk or by calling our Customer Service Team on 020 8547 5002
